item.title: Fly tipping in the river cray, 17th November
item.description:
Noticed this morning on my dog walk. A pallet, chair and traffic cone has been dumped in the river.

item.title: Dedicated right-turn light goes green at same times as oncoming traffic's light goes green, 17th November
item.description:
The right-turn light from Half Moon Lane onto Dulwich Road goes green at the same time as the light from Norwood Road onto Half Moon Lane goes green. This can be misleading, as the right-turn light doesn't mean it is safe to turn.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich Road, Herne Hill, London Borough of Lambeth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household rubbish fly tipping, 17th November
item.description:
This rubbish has been dumped by someone and has been there for many weeks. Please remove asap as it attracts more fly tipping. It‚Äôs located on Swan Mead, near Tower Bridge Road end, just outside gate of car park behind Brighton buildings. Sometimes a car parks in front of the rubbish and it‚Äôs hard to see. Thank you

item.title: Bad fly tip, 17th November
item.description:
I reported a fly tip not even 3 weeks ago and yet another fly tip has happened and needs to be dealt with asap as this it an over 60s road and needs 24/7 access for emergency services on the last fly this that was on this road multiple cars was damaged due to wood all over the road please can someone help asap as it needs cleaning

item.title: Broken glass/ piss stains, 17th November
item.description:
Reported already the glass but it still hasn't be swept up fully which is an issue for the cyclist‚Äôs using the gym. The whole area has not been swept properly as there are cigarette butts everywhere and constantly piss/ sick in the corner as they use it as a urinal over night. Can this area have a power wash to get rid of the stench and anyway to repel people from doing this?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elephant Road, Elephant and Castle, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking on the pavement in roman way at 9:11 and again at 9:35 in main avenue, 17th November
item.description:
Parking on the pavement at 9:11am two vehicles from Enfield council blocking up the pavement in roman way in photo one and in photo numbers two the same two vehicles Parking on the pavement in main avenue at 9:35 am Enfield council stuff should know better than that üò°üò°üò° but I haven't get a photo of the other vehicle from Enfield council as they was both parked right in front of one another

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermine Side, Southbury, Enfield, London Borough of Enfield
